Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian early patterned or Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black; exterior: reserved band at junction of bowl and foot; outside of foot glazed; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: The number 437 is written in pencil on the underside of the foot. The early patterned and Wild Goat Style chalices have a heavy and low conical foot. The foot is covered in a black slip on the exterior and reserved on the underside. The bowl, when attached, is coated in black slip with no decoration.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 437)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 39)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0262) (phase 2)
